step.framework.extensions
Class ExtensionEngine

java.lang.Object
  step.framework.extensions.ExtensionEngine

public class ExtensionEngine
extends java.lang.Object

The Extension Engine is a singleton object that represents the framework's extension engine.

It is responsible for configuration loading and supports their execution.

getContext

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getContext()
Obtain extension-engine context.
This context is unique for the whole extension engine. It can be used by different extensions to share data.

init

public void init()
          throws ExtensionEngineException
Initialize the extensions engine assuming the default extensions configuration resource path.

Throws:
ExtensionEngineException - when initialization fails

init

public void init(java.lang.String extensionsPropertiesResourcePath)
          throws ExtensionEngineException
Initialize the extensions engine using the provided extensions configuration resource path.

Extensions initialization has two main steps:
1st - load main configuration file and extension's configuration files
2nd - start the engine i.e. interpret configuration files and start all extensions

If no main configuration file is found the engine disables itself and doesn't throw an exception.
If a configuration file exists but contains errors the engine throws an exception with the cause.

Parameters:
extensionsPropertiesResourcePath - extensions property file resource path
Throws:
ExtensionEngineException - when initialization failed

destroy

public void destroy()
             throws ExtensionEngineException
Destroy the extensions engine.

Throws:
ExtensionEngineException - when destruction failed
